author: Special Correspondent
text:
‘Akanksha 2016’ a two-day institute-industry interface event, hosted by the Department of Tourism Studies, Pondicherry University, which is celebrating its silver jubilee, began here on Friday.

The flagship programme of the Department features panel discussions and special lectures involving distinguished industry practitioners, entrepreneurs, experts from the public sector, and academics from across the country. The silver jubilee edition of the annual event was inaugurated by Sunil Kumar, president of the Travel Agents Association of India (TAAI).

He also released the annual publication of the Department - the Yatra Magazine. Tammareddy Bharadwaj, award winning film producer and director of Telugu film industry, released the PUTSAL- Alumni Newsletter published by the Department.

Prof. G. Anjaneya Swamy, Dean-in-charge, School of Management presided over the function.

Valmiki Hari Kishan, Project Director, Valmiki Foundation, Secunderabad, initiated the distribution of study materials and stationery articles to school children from the villages adjacent to Pondicherry University.

Tourism lab

Shoeb Samad, Regional Director, India Tourism, Chennai, inaugurated a Tourism Lab.

Dr. Y. Venkata Rao, Head of the Department, also participated.

Earlier, as a curtain raiser to the Akanksha, the Department hosted the Saurabham, an event featuring local village sports for school children in the Mathur Government School located near the University.

Students and teachers were also given medals and certificates.

A team from the Department screened educational and inspirational movies in the school last week.

Silver jubilee edition of Akanksha hosted by Department of Tourism Studies inaugurated
title: 2-day institute-industry interface at Pondicherry University
